result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric D. Dickrell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric D. Dickrell in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF60, 15CF127
3:09 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 
State files amended information in 15CF60.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Atty Sheets received a copy of the amended information and waives its reading. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes. Victim is not present. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF60 Counts 2, 3 & 4 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF60 Counts 2, 3 & 4 of the amended information.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Convictions this date.

15CF60 Count 1 is dismissed and read-in.  
15CF127 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sheets makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
15CF60 Count 3 - 
30 days jail
3 days credit
Huber for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow.
Allowed to serve half on electronic monitoring, if he qualifies. 
Allowed to transfer to another county if arrangments can be made. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date.
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid within 60 days. 

15CF60 Count 2 - 
150 days jail, Consecutive to Count 3 - STAYED
2 days credit
Placed on probation for a period of 2 years: 
No contact with Bobbi Jo Pliska unless she consents in writing and the agent approves. 
Participat ein nay other assesment and counseling ecommended by the agent
Pay costs including the DNA and Domestic Abuse surcharges. 

15CF60 Count 4 -
150 days jail, concurrent to Count 2 - STAYED
2 days credit
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months:
Pay costs including the DNA Surcharge. 
Comply with all conditions of probation listed in Count 2.

Atty Sheets requests 3 days jail credit. 
Atty Cousins makes arguments.

Defendant Eric D. Dickrell in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

3:27 pm. Atty Cousins calls case.

Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

15CF60 is also set for PTC 5-26-15 @ 10:30 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Eric D. Dickrell in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

State recommends a $2,500 signature bond with conditions as stated.

Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
